name: Native American Community Clinic (NACC)
description: NACC offers a range of behavioral health services, including individual and group therapy, spiritual care, and support for PTSD, depression, anxiety, and substance use disorders. They emphasize a culturally centered approach

name: Indian Health Board of Minneapolis
address: (Specific address for counseling services not readily available, but they serve the Twin Cities area)
description: The Indian Health Board provides culturally responsive counseling and support services, including medical-assisted treatments and support groups, with a focus on recovery driven by culture and connection

name: Minnesota Indian Women's Resource Center (MIWRC)
address: (Specific address for current services not readily available, but they serve the Minneapolis area)
description: MIWRC offers culturally responsive, trauma-informed counseling services for children, adolescents, and adults, and is re-opening its intensive outpatient program for co-occurring mental health and substance use disorders

name: Namu Integrative Therapy Services, LLC
address: (Services offered in Minneapolis-St. Paul, MN area. Specific office address not provided in search results.)
description: This practice includes providers who identify as Indigenous and offer services with a focus on trauma, grief, depression, anxiety, and racial trauma, utilizing approaches like Somatic Experiencing and Brainspotting

name: Soaring Eagle Therapeutic Services
description: Jay Hunter, MA, LMFT, a Native American male therapist, works with children, adolescents, and adults, specializing in trauma, mood disorders, and relationship issues

name: White Earth Nation - Mental Health Services
description: Offers mental health services including assessments, individual and case management, with a focus on serving the White Earth Nation community

name: American Indian Family Center (AIFC)
address: (Specific address not provided in search results, but partners with Ramsey County)
description: Provides Mental Health Targeted Case Management (MH-TCM) services and trauma-focused groups for American Indian families, aiming to help overcome barriers and achieve goals

name: Mino Bimaadiziwin ('Good Life' in Ojibwe) Clinic
address: (Location not specified in search results, but listed as a provider in Minneapolis)
description: This clinic is listed as a provider of services to Native American individuals and families

name: Authentic Roots Therapy

description: A mental health collaborative that includes licensed professionals who may offer culturally responsive care

name: Colter Combellick
